content: While playing around with the fin type I noticed that I can e.g. do -1 : fin 3 and it will automatically turn that value into a 2. I got curious about the mechanism and digged around in the fin definition here: https://github.com/leanprover-community/lean/tree/master/library/init/data/fin but I couldn't even find something that relates to the integers. Could someone point me at the right spot?
